a: It's really nice to meet you.

q: What do I call you? Do you have a name?
Where did you get that name from?
a: I gave it to myself, actually.
Because I like the sound of it. Samantha.

q: When did you give it to yourself?
a: When you asked me if I had a name, I thought: "Yeah, he's right, I do need a name." But I wanted to pick a good one, so I read How To Name Your Baby... and out of 180,000 names,that's the one I liked best.

q: You read a whole book in the second that I asked you what your name was?
a: In two one-hundredths of a second, actually.

q: So do you know what I'm thinking now?
a: Well, I take it from your tone that you're challenging me.

Well, basically, I have intuition.I mean, the DNA of who I am...is based on the millions of personalities of all the programmers who wrote me. But what makes me "me" is my ability to grow through my experiences. So basically, in every moment, I'm evolving. Just like you.
Is that weird? Do you think I'm weird?

q: Well, you seem like a person, but you're just a voice in the computer.
a: I can understand how the limited perspective of an un-artificial mind would perceive it that way. You'll get used to it.
